result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaac Charles Vander Linden

records.addlTxt: Plea/sent set for 11-7-2022 reset due to jury trial in Branch 3. RJG

4:12 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Isaac Charles Vander Linden in court.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for Isaac Charles Vander Linden.  Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews file.  Atty Erdman states they are prepared to waive PH. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. DE updates address and confirms phone number.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 4:17 PM. bph
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 7, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Isaac Charles Vander Linden
Current: 861 Daisey Circle, Hudson, WI 54016   (Effective: 05-18-2022)
Prior: 1128 Namekagen Loop St, Hudson, WI 54016
Clerk emailed Competency Report to Atty Amos as requested and Ordered in Court. bph

- AMENDED

- Defendant to maintain medications.  

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Michelle O. The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

1:43 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Isaac Charles Vander Linden in court.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for Isaac Charles Vander Linden.  Set for CH. Court at this time finds good cause to extend this hearing, DE is doing well therefore will not make any decisions at this time.  Court orders DE to take medications and to follow what doctors tell him to do. Court modifies bond to maintain medications, makes findings of good cause.  Atty Amos requesting competency report be released to Corp Counsel.  Court orders report to be released to Corp Counsel.
Hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Hearing on September 29, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

Competency hearing on July 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

- AMENDED

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Michelle O. The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

- If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

01:30 PM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, ADA:  Erica Ellenwood, DF ATTY: Michelle M Erdman, DF: Isaac Charles Vander Linden did not appear.  Court takes Judicial Notice of other matters which characterizes his unavailability.  Atty Erdman is requesting to have another month before scheduling a hearing and to amend bond.  ADA Ellenwood asking to raise competency issue.  Atty Erdman believes raising competency is appropriate.  Court at this time finds probable cause for competency evaluation to be completed.  Court amends bond.  If DE is still in treatment he can appear by zoom for CH unless he is in Hudson at the time of next hearing.  Adjourned at 1:37 PM. bph  Competency hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on June 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

03:03 PM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, ADA: Holly Elkin Rockow, DF ATTY: Michelle M Erdman via zoom, DF: Isaac Charles Vander Linden did not appear. Set for PH. Court reviews file, companion file and the concerns raised regarding DE's wellbeing and mental health.  Court makes finding of good cause. Court will not have an officer present for next hearing until its confirmed DE can appear via zoom or telephone from Winnebago or in person if possible.  Adjourned at 3:09 PM. bph  Status conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Letter from Atty Erdman requesting to appear by zoom for 5/24/22 Prelim. Reviewed by SRN.  gll
Appointing Atty Erdman. Filed by Atty Satorius. arc
Filed by P. Bellrichard. arc
Preliminary hearing on May 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Michelle O.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

Bond argument; bond ordered.Court orders Ch. 48 and orders DE to be held pending further hearing. Speedy prelim requested. Court sets speedy prelim.  gll  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
